mods.abstract: Letter addressed by Pope Pius VI to Scipione de' Ricci, Bishop of Pistoia-Prato, in reply to the bishop's complaint about two nuns of the Monestary of Santa Caterina who are on the road to perdition and whose heresies and misdeeds border on the incredible. Part of an artificial collection created by the dealer, Bernard M. Rosenthal. Handwritten dealer notes by Rosenthal are included with the document when they include more information than written on each folder.

location.physicalLocation: Stanford University. Libraries. Department of Special Collections and University Archives

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Description based on EAD of finding aid. Custom transform of EAD to MODS used.

mods.accessCondition: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Special Collections Public Services Librarian at speccollref@stanford.edu.
